Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: COMPOSITE_SURVEY_ID: Unique identifier for the composite directional survey.
Column Comment.2: COMPOSITE SOURCE: the source of the composite directional survey.
Column Comment.3: COMPOSITE OBS NO: unique number for the composite. Use the ArchitecturalPrinciple to assign.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique number added to a PK, in which order does notmatter, or where date or some other value is used to determine order. Use theArchitectural Principle to assign.
Column Comment.6: OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique number added to a PK, in which order does notmatter, or where date or some other value is used to determine order. Use theArchitectural Principle to assign.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first comes into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row is no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.10: INPUT_SURVEY_ID: the survey identifier for the input well directional survey put intothe creation of a composite
Column Comment.11: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
